name: Larry Coryell
description: '''Larry Coryell''' (born '''Lorenz Albert Van DeLinder III'''; April 2, 1943 – February 19, 2017) was an American [[jazz rock guitarist]], widely considered the "godfather of [[Jazz rock|jazz rock]]". Alongside [[Gábor Szabó]], he was a pioneer in melding jazz, [[Country music|country]] and [[rock music]]. Coryell was also a [[music teacher]] and a writer, penning a monthly column for ''[[Guitar Player]]'' magazine from 1977 to 1989. He collaborated with a number of other high-profile musicians, including [[John McLaughlin (musician)|John McLaughlin]], [[Chick Corea]], [[Miroslav Vitouš]], [[Billy Cobham]], [[Lenny White]], [[Emily Remler]], [[Al Di Meola]], [[Paco de Lucía]], [[Steve Morse]] and others.
